intro: Scrophularia bosniaca f. pyramidalis, commonly known as the Bosnian scrophularia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its upright, pyramidal growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
